page.title: 05BOXWORTH - EXPERIMENTAL FARM
page.content: Boxworth Experimental Husbandry Farm is one of a chain of twelve centres operated Nationwide by the Agricultural Development Advisory Service. The farms are designed to provide information for advisors and farmers on all aspects of agricultural production. Boxworth E.H.F draws attention to any local problems requiring investigation. This 347 hectare farm lies on the clay plateau at an average altitude of 50 metres. The soils are derived from chalky boulder clay. Although these soils are difficult to work and have an impervious subsoil requiring artificial drainage, the soil is naturally rich in potash and has a good physical structure.
